intro: Nymphaea flavovirens, commonly known as the golden-green water lily, is a species of aquatic plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features strikingly colored flowers that range from bright yellow to greenish-yellow, often with a distinctive purple or brown center. The plant has broad, floating leaves that provide habitat for various aquatic organisms. Its roots anchor it in the muddy substrate of ponds and slow-moving streams. Nymphaea flavovirens plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by supporting biodiversity and contributing to water quality through oxygenation.
